election_record.label: New York 1816 State Senate, Middle District

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: George D. Wickham received 1 vote as George Wickham.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: Martin Van Buren received 1 vote as Martin Van.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: No results from Tompkins were reported.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: The vote for Greene County includes the returns from Greenville. "The returns from Greenville rejected, the transcript not having been certified by the county clerk." The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). June 15, 1816.

"From Our Correspondent, Catskill, May 4, 1816, Gentlemen, The following are additional returns; ( Town of Cairo - Official ) - Republican majority for .... Senators 6. Greeneville .... Senators equal." Commercial Advertiser (New York, NY). May 6, 1816

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: George D. Wickham received 1 vote as George Wickham.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Martin Van Buren received 1 vote as Martin Van Burn.

sub_unit.name: Unadilla
sub_unit.note: Martin Van Buren received 1 vote as M. V. Buren.

election_record.reference: Original Election Certificate, Town of Carlisle.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). May 14, 1816.
The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). June 1, 1816.
